channel.title: Projects | CTRL, CODE, COMMIT: Digital Skills for the Modern PhD (CCC)

item.title: Git and GitHub
item.description:
You‚Äôve probably done this: ‚Ä¢ manuscript_v2_FINAL.docx ‚Ä¢ manuscript_v2_FINAL_revised_OK_THIS_ONE.tex ‚Ä¢ manuscript_v2_FINAL_revised_OK_THIS_ONE_FOR_REAL_bis_bis.docx

‚Ä¶we‚Äôve all been there.

It‚Äôs time to break up with folders full of confusing file versions and discover Git: the ultimate time machine, collaboration engine, and safety net for your research.

In this hands-on tutorial, you‚Äôll learn: ‚Ä¢ üóÇÔ∏è How to track changes in your code, scripts, or manuscripts ‚Ä¢ üß† How to stop fearing overwrites or ‚Äúbreaking everything‚Äù ‚Ä¢ ü§ù How to collaborate without emailing ZIP files ‚Ä¢ üõ†Ô∏è How to use GitHub (and understand what a ‚Äúpull request‚Äù actually is) ‚Ä¢ üîç How Git supports open, transparent, and reproducible research

No prior experience needed ‚Äî if you can save a file, you can learn Git. And once you do, you‚Äôll wonder how you ever worked without it.

Let‚Äôs make version control your new best research habit.

item.title: PyTorch
item.description: PyTorch is a Python package that provides tensor computation (like NumPy) with strong GPU acceleration.

item.title: scikit-learn
item.description: scikit-learn is a Python module for machine learning built on top of SciPy and is distributed under the 3-Clause BSD license.
